fullProgramDescription: The Department of Classics at UCLA offers a comprehensive program in Greek and Latin, focusing on the literary, historical, and cultural achievements of ancient Greece and Rome. Students engage with a broad range of texts, from Homer and Greek tragedy to Roman epic and historiography, developing their understanding of the classical world and its ongoing influence on Western culture. Through coursework in language, literature, and history, the program aims to cultivate critical thinking, linguistic proficiency, and a nuanced understanding of the ancient Mediterranean.
shortProgramDescription: The Greek and Latin B.A. at UCLA provides a rigorous foundation in classical languages and cultures, preparing students for diverse careers or further study.

learningOutcomes: Read and analyze Greek and/or Latin texts at an advanced level.
Understand the cultural, historical, and literary contexts of classical antiquity.
Apply critical thinking and theoretical approaches to the study of classical texts and cultures.
Communicate effectively about classical subjects in written and oral forms.
Recognize the ongoing influence of classical culture in later periods.
Demonstrate an awareness of the diverse methodologies and theories used in classical studies.
additionalInformation: Students are advised to consult with departmental advisors to plan their course of study. The program encourages study abroad and participation in archaeological field schools.
